docs.snippet: Chief executives of major U.S. companies huddled with President Donald Trump at the White House on Friday and some of them expressed concern about a travel ban on people from seven Muslim-majority countries traveling to the United States....
docs.lead_paragraph: Chief executives of major U.S. companies huddled with President Donald Trump at the White House on Friday and some of them expressed concern about a travel ban on people from seven Muslim-majority countries traveling to the United States.

headline.main: U.S. Business Leaders Express Concerns to Trump About Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: U.S. Business Leaders Express Concerns to Trump About Travel Ban

docs.snippet: A high-profile conference on Libya planned for mid-February in Washington has been postponed, the organizers said on Friday, citing U.S. President Donald Trump's temporary ban on nationals of seven Muslim-majority countries, including Libya, from ...
docs.lead_paragraph: A high-profile conference on Libya planned for mid-February in Washington has been postponed, the organizers said on Friday, citing U.S. President Donald Trump's temporary ban on nationals of seven Muslim-majority countries, including Libya, from entering the United States.

headline.main: U.S. Conference on Libya Postponed Over Trump Travel Ban: Organizers
headline.print_headline: U.S. Conference on Libya Postponed Over Trump Travel Ban: Organizers

docs.snippet: About 60,000 visas were revoked under U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order temporarily halting immigration from seven Muslim-majority countries, the State Department said on Friday, in one of several government communications clarifying h...
docs.lead_paragraph: About 60,000 visas were revoked under U.S. President Donald Trump's executive order temporarily halting immigration from seven Muslim-majority countries, the State Department said on Friday, in one of several government communications clarifying how the order is being rolled out.

headline.main: Trump's Travel Ban Has Revoked 60,000 Visas for Now
headline.print_headline: Trump's Travel Ban Has Revoked 60,000 Visas for Now

docs.snippet: President Trump’s order banning Iraqis from entering the United States came in the midst of the Iraqi Army’s fight for the city of Mosul....
docs.lead_paragraph: President Trump’s order banning Iraqis from entering the United States came in the midst of the Iraqi Army’s fight for the city of Mosul.

headline.main: Travel Ban Drives Wedge Between Iraqi Soldiers and Americans
headline.print_headline: Travel Ban Strains Ties to Troops Across Iraq

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

byline.contributor: An employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Mosul, Iraq, and Falih Hassan contributed from Baghdad.

docs.snippet: Jordanian airline Royal Jordanian received instructions from the U.S. authorities on Saturday allowing travelers from Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Sudan, Somali and Iran to board its flights to the United States if they have the necessary visa....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jordanian airline Royal Jordanian received instructions from the U.S. authorities on Saturday allowing travelers from Syria, Iraq, Yemen, Libya, Sudan, Somali and Iran to board its flights to the United States if they have the necessary visa.

headline.main: Royal Jordanian Gets U.S. Instructions Lifting Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Royal Jordanian Gets U.S. Instructions Lifting Travel Ban

docs.snippet: Legal battles are playing out across the U.S. as opponents of President Donald Trump's travel ban on citizens from seven predominantly Muslim nations take their fight to the courtroom. Hearings were being held Friday in a few of the cases....
docs.lead_paragraph: Legal battles are playing out across the U.S. as opponents of President Donald Trump's travel ban on citizens from seven predominantly Muslim nations take their fight to the courtroom. Hearings were being held Friday in a few of the cases.

headline.main: How Legal Challenges to Trump Travel Ban Are Playing Out
headline.print_headline: How Legal Challenges to Trump Travel Ban Are Playing Out

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said the Justice Department will win an appeal filed late Saturday of a judge's order lifting a travel ban he had imposed on citizens of seven mainly Muslim countries....
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. President Donald Trump said the Justice Department will win an appeal filed late Saturday of a judge's order lifting a travel ban he had imposed on citizens of seven mainly Muslim countries.

headline.main: Trump-U.S. Will Win Appeal of Judge's Travel Ban Order
headline.print_headline: Trump-U.S. Will Win Appeal of Judge's Travel Ban Order

docs.snippet: A U.S. anti-poverty group said on Wednesday it is joining a Massachusetts lawsuit to strike down President Donald Trump's travel ban, as the law has blocked overseas partners from meeting with officials in Washington....
docs.lead_paragraph: A U.S. anti-poverty group said on Wednesday it is joining a Massachusetts lawsuit to strike down President Donald Trump's travel ban, as the law has blocked overseas partners from meeting with officials in Washington.

headline.main: Aid Group Joins Massachusetts Lawsuit Over Trump Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Aid Group Joins Massachusetts Lawsuit Over Trump Travel Ban

docs.snippet: Prominent Democrats, including John Kerry and Madeleine K. Albright, wrote a letter to an appeals court saying that the immigration order endangers troops and undermines security....
docs.lead_paragraph: Prominent Democrats, including John Kerry and Madeleine K. Albright, wrote a letter to an appeals court saying that the immigration order endangers troops and undermines security.

headline.main: Kerry and Albright Ask Courts to Keep Blocking Trump’s Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: Ex-Officials Join Fight Against  Travel Ban

docs.snippet: A watchdog agency at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said it is planning to review how President Donald Trump's immigration executive order to temporarily suspend travel from seven majority-Muslim nations was implemented....
docs.lead_paragraph: A watchdog agency at the U.S. Department of Homeland Security said it is planning to review how President Donald Trump's immigration executive order to temporarily suspend travel from seven majority-Muslim nations was implemented.

headline.main: U.S. Watchdog Agency to Review Implementation of Trump Travel Ban
headline.print_headline: U.S. Watchdog Agency to Review Implementation of Trump Travel Ban
